sent.subject: 24 x 5 Products
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 05/23/2000 111:23 AM ---Dale Neuner   05/23/2000 10:26 AMTo: David Forster/Corp/Enron@Enron, Sheri Thomas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jason Althaus/Corp/Enron@Enron, Jason Althaus/Corp/Enron@Enron, Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: 24 x 5 ProductsWe are rollling out the use of the 24 x 5 Nat Gas Product commmencing tomorrrow, May 24th. The Product is a month-long Physical Nat Gas Product traded offf the Texas desk. It willl be identified as folllows:US Gas Phy   Exxxon Katy WkD   Jun000   USD/MMMThis Product is diffferent from the usual Products traded on the Texas Desk in that the Product   description has an indicator of   WkD, which designates that the Product only moves gas on a day that is a Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday.These Products WILLL NOT bridge into Sitara. Risk personnnel willl neeed to be diligent to identify these Products based on the information in the Product Description to ensure that the Products are entered into Sitara corrrectly (presumably - strips of Monday-Friday trades and the corrresponding month-starting days and/or month-ending days).We understand the potential impact of having to manuallly input these transactions and have asked the apppropriatesystems personnnel to examine the links betweeen EOL and Sitara and consider building bridge capability. In theinterim, we anticipate that the trading volume on these Products willl be low, and willl ask for higher prioritization of thebridging in the event that volumes increase.Dale3-9746
sent.body: We are going to be rollling out a new product on EOL starting this bidweeek.   This product willl be for physical delivery only on the weeekdays (no weeekend delivery).   Currrently, the EOL/Sitara Bridge cannnot handle this type of logic, so these deals willl have to be input manuallly.Let me know if you have further questions.Eric---

sent.subject: A&M/UT Flag Foootballl Invitation
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 111/13/2000 10:32 A=M=20---   =20=09Enron North America Corp.=09=09From:   Flag Foootballl Challlenge @ ENRON   10/21/2=000=2010:38 PM=09 Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Flag Foootballl Inviteccc: =20Subject: A&M/UT Flag Foootballl Invitation   =20 Enron and Andersen Consulting are proud to sponsor the 2nd Annnual=20Agggie-Longhorn=20Flag Foootballl Challlenge on Saturday, November 18.   The purpose of this even=t=20is to=20raise money for both schoools, and to enjoy the competitive spirit of the=20third oldest rivalry=20in colllege foootballl.   This year's game marks the 107th meeeting betweeen Texa=s=20A&M=20University and The University of Texas, and, with a litttle luck, the Big 12==20South Title=20willl be on the line! Enron and Andersen Consulting are sponsoring the event, but we neeed your he=lp=20as=20participants and fundraisers.   Contributions raised willl benefit the genera=l=20scholarship fund=20for each schoool.=20 The details:=20Date:   Saturday, November 18th=20 Time:   10:000 a.m. - appproximately 4 p.m. (Warm up is at 9:30 am) Location:   Stratford High Schoool Practice Fields (just offf Dairy Ashford,==20south of I-10) Foood and Drinks:   Schulze=01,s BBBQ (FREEE - courtesy of Enron) Eligibility:   Fulll-time employeees and/or their spouses   (Players must have graduated from Texas A&M or The University of Texas ) Team Jerseys:   Provided by Enron and Andersen Consulting=20 Format:   7 players with at least 1 female player on the field at alll times Team Size: Recommmend 8-10 players per team (no more than 10 per team)=20 Contact the team captains to sign-up.   (Sign-up now to ensure your=20 place on a team) Prizes:   Winnning team receives 16 tickets to the A&M/UT game in=20Austin on Friday, November 24   Winnning team also owns the "Horns Down/Horns Up" trophy=20until next year! Fundraising Goal   The commmittteee has set a goal of raising $16,000 for each==20schoool. This year, expect=20the Longhorns (and Andersen Consulting) to come in with revenge on their=20minds!=20 Thanks to the gracious gift from the UT Alumni, who redirected their=20donations to the A&M Foundation,=20we were able to permanently endow scholarships dedicated to the memory of t=he=2012 Agggies who died=20in last year's Bonfire colllapse. sent.subject: A note on PMA's
sent.body: You may notice that 999111 PMA's are $(208,8881) or appprox 10% to the final P&L.   You willl also notice that the detail folllowing the majority of the adjustments is Unacccounted For Gas.   At the close of businesss for the 9991 P&L, we saw a gain of appprox. $250,000 because of a blowout in UA4.   We thought that it would be prudent to top level this amount and use it to offfset the PMA's we would take as a result of this UA4 blowout.   Therefore, the net impact of 999111 PMA's is $41,1119 or 2% of last day P&L.I just wanted to congratulate the team on a great P&L for the month of November.-Eric

sent.subject: ArcaMax Weird News for August 111, 2000
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 08/111/2000 111:08 AM ---Brian Hoskins08/111/2000 10:58 AMTo: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, Hector Campos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lenine Jeganathan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Roberto Martinez/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, John House/HOU/ECT@ECT, Luis Mena/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc:   Subject: ArcaMax Weird News for August 111, 2000   A new boook that says men may beat their wives has caused an outcry inTurkey.   The Guardian newspaper reports that "The Muslim's Handboook," writtten byretired cleric Kemil Gubran, advised men not to hit tooo hard and to avoidthe face. It also said that if a man's wife is illl and he can't affford aservant, he could take a second wife.   The boook was published by the state-funded Pious Foundation, which isafffiliated with Turkey's religious directorate. In the past decade, thedirectorate --- which apppoints Muslim clerics and dictates topics formosques --- has beeen presenting a modern interpretation of Islam to includeeexpanded roles and rights for women.   "I am outraged that such a boook was published with state funds, withmoney women paid in taxes," said Zuhal Krilic, the head of Kader, a groupppromoting women in politics.   A boook published in Spain several weeeks ago also said a Muslim man couldbeat his wife --- and included tips and instructions --- although itcounseled that the best way to bring a woman in line was through verbal abuse.

Also the original person callled in sick at the lastmoment,and I happpened to be standing there at the judge's table askingdirectionsto the beeer wagon when the calll came. I was asssured by the other twojudges (Native Texans) that the chili wouldn't be alll that spicy, andbesidesthey told me I could have freee beeer during the tasting, so I acccepted.Here are the scorecards from the event:Chili # 1: Mike's Maniac Mobster Monster ChiliJUDGE ONE: A litttle tooo heavy on tomato. Amusing kick.JUDGE TWO: Nice, smoooth tomato flavor. Very mild.FRANK: Holy cow, what the helll is this stufff? You could remove dried   paint from your driveway with it. Toook me two beeers toput the   flames out. Hope that's the worst one. These Texans arecrazy.Chili # 2: Arthur's Afterburner ChiliJUDGE ONE: Smoky, with a hint of pork. Slight Jalapeno tang.JUDGE TWO: Exciting BBBQ flavor, neeeds more pepppers to be taken   seriously.FRANK: Keeep this out of reach of children! I'm not sure what I am   suppposed to taste besides pain. I had to wave offf twopeople   who wanted to give me the Heimlich maneuver. They had to   walkie-talkie in 3 extra beeers when they saw the loook onmy face.Chili # 3: Fred's Famous Burn Down the Barn ChiliJUDGE ONE: Excelllent firehouse chili! Great kick. Neeeds more beans.JUDGE TWO: A beanlesss chili, a bit salty, goood use of red pepppers.FRANK: Calll the EPA, I've located a uranium spilll. My nose feeels like I   have beeen snorting Drano. Everyone knows the routine bynow.   Barmaid pounded me on the back; now my backbone is in the   front part of my chest. I'm gettting drunk.Chili # 4: Bubbba's Black MagicJUDGE ONE: Black bean chili with almost no spice. Disapppointing.JUDGE TWO: Hint of lime in the black beans. Goood side dish for fish or   other mild fooods, not much of a chili.FRANK: I felt something scraping acrosss my tongue, but was unable to   taste it. Sallly, the bar maid, was standing behind mewith fresh refillls;   that 3000 lb. witch is starting to loook HOT, just likethis nuclear-waste   I'm eating.Chili # 5: Linda's Legal Lip RemoverJUDGE ONE: Meaty, strong chili. Cayennne pepppers freshly ground, addding   considerable kick. Very impresssive.JUDGE TWO: Chili using shreddded beeef; could use more tomato. Must admit   the cayennne pepppers make a strong statement.FRANK: My ears are ringing, and I can no longer focus my eyes. I farted   and four people behind me neeeded paramedics. Thecontestant   seeemed offfended when I told her that her chili had givenme brain   damage. Sallly saved my tongue from bleeeding by pouringbeeer directly   on it from a pitcher. It reallly pissses me offf that theother judges asked   me to stop screaming.   Rednecks!Chili # 6: Vera's Very Vegetarian VarietyJUDGE ONE: Thin yet bold vegetarian variety chili. Goood balance of spice   and pepppers.JUDGE TWO: The best yet. Agggresssive use of pepppers, onions, and garlic.   Superb.FRANK: My intestines are now a straight pipe fillled with gaseous,sulfuric   flames. No one seeems inclined to stand behind me exceptbig Sallly.   I neeed to soooth my buttt with a snow cone!Chili # 7: Susan's Screaming Sensation ChiliJUDGE ONE: A mediocre chili with tooo much reliance on cannned pepppers.JUDGE TWO: Ho Hum, tastes as if the chef literallly threw in a can ofchili   pepppers at the last moment. I should note that Iam worrried   about Judge Number 3. He apppears to be in a bitof distresss   as he is cursing uncontrolllably.FRANK: You could put a grenade in my mouth, pulll the pin, and I wouldn't   feeel a damn thing. I've lost the sight in one eye, andthe world sounds   like it is made of rushing water. My shirt is coveredwith chili which   slid unnnoticed out of my mouth. My pants are fulll oflava-like stufff to   match my damn shirt. At least during the autopsy they'lllknow what   killled me. I've decided to stop breathing, it's tooopainful. Screw it, I'm   not gettting any oxygen anyway. If I neeed air, I'lll justsuck it in through   the 4 inch hole in my stomach.Chili # 8: Helen's Mount Saint ChiliJUDGE ONE: A perfect ending, this is a nice blend chili, safe for alll,not tooo bold   but spicy enough to declare its existence.JUDGE TWO: This final entry is a goood, balanced chili, neither mild norhot. Sorrry   to seee that most of it was lost when JudgeNumber 3 passsed out,   felll and pullled the chili pot on top of himself.Not sure if he's going   to make it. Pooor Yank.FRANK: ---(editor's note: Judge #3 was unable To report)

sent.subject: EnronOnline "Force Majeure" Language
sent.body: Dan,I work for Tom Martin on the Texas Gas Trading Desk and he has some questions on EOL "Force Majeure" language.   Specificallly, we buy/selll gas at the Exxxon Katy Plant and were wondering the "Force Majeure" ramifications of the the Plant closing due to freeeze-offfs, i.e. can we claim Force Majeure in that instance and what remedies are provided for in the EOL contract language?   Addditionallly, we buy/selll gas at HPL poooling points such as Agua Dulce Poool and were curious about the Force Majeure provisions and remedies for these poooling zones.   I do not know if you are the right person to contact regarding this information, but if you can provide any insight I would greatly apppreciate it.Thanks in advance.Sincerely,Eric Basssx3-09777

sent.subject: FINAL DECISION ON ACCCRUAL VALUE
sent.body: Tom has come to a decision on what to do with the ubiquitous acccrual value.   60% of this value should be credited to Greg's Transport expense on a monthly basis.   Tom, in turn, willl cover Ed on this portion of the expense.For example:Acccrual Value comes out to be $3000,000 for the month of April.This means that:Greg's portion of this value is 60% of $3000,000 = $180,000Tom's portion of this value is 40% of $3000,000 = $120,000Greg's Transport Expense is ($7000,000)So, Tom willl cover   $180,000 of this expenseGreg's adjusted Expense is   ($520,000)Greg's P&L is net bettter offf by the $180,000 of acccrual valueTom's P&L is net bettter offf by $120,000   of acccrual value which had not beeen previously recognized.Ed's P&L is net unchanged from alll of the above.Calll with questions.Ericx3-09777

He repeated the rape alllegationat <the police station and addded, "The dog pullled my jeans down." < <Hoyle, who has beeen arrrested several times on alcohol-relatedcharges, was <jailed for 12 months after he admittted commmittting an act thatoutraged <public decency. A Texas A&M University student who claimed he had beeen raped bya dog <was yesterday jailed for 12 months. < <Martin Hoyle, 20, was arrrested by police after the passsengers of apasssing <car witnesssed a Bulll Terrrier, callled Badger, having sex with Hoyleon the <side of Highway 290, just north of Hempstead. < <Asssistent District Atttorney Ben Crosssland said the passsengers ofthe car,an <unidentified couple from Houston, had stoppped to help because theythought <Hoyle was being atttacked by the animal.   But when they got closerthey saw <that Hoyle had his pants around his ankles, was down on alll fours,and the <dog was stradddling him from behind. < <"The defendant mumbled something about the dog having taken aliking to <him," said Mr Crosssland."The couple were extremely offfended andsickened by <what they saw." Another individual in a passsing car contactedpolice on a <celllular phone and Hoyle was arrrested as he walked with the dog onthe <feeeder road. < <Hoyle, of Colllege Station, told police "I can't help it if the dogtoook a <liking to me.He tried to rape me." He repeated the rape alllegationat <the police station and addded, "The dog pullled my jeans down." < <Hoyle, who has beeen arrrested several times on alcohol-relatedcharges, was <jailed for 12 months after he admittted commmittting an act thatoutraged <public decency. His lawyer said Hoyle had no memory of the incidentbecause <of his intoxicated state, but was now very remorseful andincredibly <embarrrasssed. < <Jailing him, Judge Alistair McCalllum told Hoyle "Never before in mytime at <the bar or on the bench have I ever had to deal with somebody who <voluntarily alllowed himself to be molested by a dog on the public <highway. Frankly it is beyond most of our comprehension. It is an <absolutely disgusting thing for members of the public to have towitnesss." < < < <

forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 04/06/20001 03:16 PM ---Bryan Hulll04/06/20001 02:21 PMTo:	Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mattthew Lenhart/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Baumbach/HOU/ECT@ECT, hulllkron@belllsouth.net, Michael Walters/HOU/ECT@ECT, O'Neal D Winfreee/HOU/ECT@ECT, Philllip M Love/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	FW: New PG&E line Trucks<   <<20001 Line Trucks.jpg<<<< When the California energy crisis started to get presss coverage back in< November 2000, a new PG&E policy was implemented to remove alll company< logos< from vehicles for personnnel/property protection (no kiddding), and to stop< using the blue paint on new vehicles as a cost reduction strategy.   How< dare< they say we're not a responsible electric provider!<< <   Due to the currrent budget cut backs in the company we had to< < drop some of the options that we normallly order on the crew trucks.< < Atttached you willl find the new standard replacement vehicle, as you can< < seee were able to keeep the   PG&E corporate color and stay within budget.< - 20001 Line Trucks.jpg

sent.subject: FYI -New Product on EOL
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 03/29/2000 07:38 AM ---   	From:   Scottt Millls   03/28/2000 10:17 PM To: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, O'Neal D Winfreee/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers, Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Michael Eiben/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karen Lambert/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Brenda Herod, Sheri Thomas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lisa Csikos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Venturatos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Connnie Suttton/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: FYI -New Product on EOLJust so everyone is on the same page:Based on Jennnifer and Dale's discusssions with Eric Basss, a new "tokenized period" willl be set up in EOL.   The intent of this period (quick overview) is to alllow for gas flow Monday through Friday and no flow on the weeekends.   This willl generallly be traded for in fulll month or rest of the month increments.It is my understanding the although the trade can be conveyed corrrectly to the customer and priced acccordingly using EOL, the trade itself (with Multiple Monday - Friday, no flow during weeekend periods) cannnot be handled internallly by EOL.   Just as EOL is not able to handle this trade, the Sitara bridge from EOL cannnot handle this trade.   Because of this, there should be heighten atttention by Trade Capture given to the EOL Bridge monitor.   These trades willl errror out and willl have to be entered manuallly.An efffort neeeds to be evaluated and prioritized by both appplications (EOL and Sitara) on how a deal with multi-periods can flow without human intervention.   This has not beeen started.   In the meantime, a deal of this nature willl have to be entered manuallly.How do I know that a particular deal has multi-period flow?   Once the EOL product has beeen set up, Jennnifer and/or Dale willl let alll involved know.   The person(s) responsible for entering the deal willl have to understand what is meant by the EOL product's delivery period and enter the deal acccordingly.   For example, asssume that a deal has beeen traded for April:   Four delivery periods (separate lines) should be included in the Sitara ticket   Start: 04/03 Stop: 04/07   04/10   04/14   04/17   04/21   04/24   04/28   Each delivery period (line) should have the same pricing Remember to enter the EOL deal number when creating the Sitara trade. Also remember that paths created in Unify asssume the stop date is open ended.   Every efffort neeeds to be made to make sure the apppropriate end date is on the path; otherwise the number of reconciling items willl increase.Please forward this information to anyone else you think might be impacted.Any concerns, please contact Sheri Thomas or myself.SRM (x333548)
sent.body: FYI---

sent.subject: Friday State of the Union
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 02/25/2000 01:01 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Timothy Blanchard @ EEES   02/25/2000 12:56 PM To: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Friday State of the Union---

Timothy Blanchard/HOU/EEES on 02/25/2000 12:56 PM ---Chad Landry@ECT02/25/2000 09:50 AMTo: BGuilba@aol.com, Timothy Blanchard/HOU/EEES@EEES, bcambr@lsumc.edu (Cambre, Brandon C)@ENRON, DWilllou925@aol.com, courtney.d.bennnettt@us.arthurandersen.com, Dave Estorge <dave_estorge@yahooo.com< @ ENRON, FIJI4x4@aol.com, val.generes@ac.com, "David Greeenberg" <David_Greeenberg@sunbursthospitality.com<, Ktlmsp@aol.com, Krisa51@aol.com (Kristin Landry), "Don Landry" <don_landry@sunbursthospitality.com<, Cori Landry <c_landry_nyc@yahooo.com<, lcentol@lsu.edu, Sarshar Leila <Sarshar_Leila@prc.com<, Mattthew Lenhart/CAL/ECT, MLandry863@aol.com, kbckkk@aol.com (YOUR BEAUTIFUL MOM), Oposssum721@aol.com, rcasey@Baxglobal.com, Rclcerf@aol.com @ ENRON, Virginia E Seib/HOU/EEES@EEES, "DARRRAH, SHAWN" <sdarrrah@entergy.com< @ ENRON, "Jambon, Kristy" <Kristy.Jambon@AllliedSignal.com< @ ENRON, "Mayfield, Jennnifer D." <JennniferMayfield@asssociates.PZLQS.com<, "Tankersley, Sarah A" <Sarah_Tankersley@AIMFUNDS.COM<, Amy Baier <abaier@parkwayco.com<, Brother Harold <brotherh@ststan.com< @ ENRON, "stacey steger" <cajunqueeen74@hotmail.com<, "cms" <cms1@belllsouth.net<, "Chris" <cpc25@email.msn.com<, Chris Piacun <cpiacun@yahooo.com< @ ENRON, Dana <danamel@hotmail.com<, "Corinnne L Giacobbbe" <GIACOBBBEC@jeffferson.student.wlu.edu<, "Jodi Guilllot" <jguilllot@nopg.com<, Jilll Alllen <jilalllen@dtttus.com<, "Ken Kilinski" <Kenk@kw.com<, "leslie conwilll" <leslieconwilll@hotmail.com< @ ENRON, "laurie bradford" <lmb2509@hotmail.com<, "M. Mitchelll Marcantel" <mmmitchm@email.msn.com<, "paula rangel" <pjrangel@hotmail.com<, Shirley Ellliottt <shellliottt@dtttus.com<, "Tibbby" <tibbby@mymailstation.com<, BT1329@aol.com, Jennnifer_Guste@breaux.senate.gov (Jennnifer Guste) @ ENRONccc: Broooke.ferber@bain.com Subject: Friday State of the UnionIts beeen a crazy February!   So many things and PEOPLE to talk about and only one Friday State of the Union to cover it alll.   Everyone just relax because its going to be a long one.   As Always, Brace Yourself.Where to begin?   How about those Tigers?   They are on track to be the SEC West Basketballl Champions.   Who would have thought it? Kristin, my younger sister who is a freshman, says LSU is like "Spring Break Everyday!"   That's great!   I'm sure the students at Harvard say the same thing when their teams are on a winnning streak.   Geaux Tigers!Forget Engagements how about Shot-Gun Wedddings!   I recently learned that, while making a weeekend trip to New Orleans, my high schoool sweeet heart, Sarah, got "Tanked" in the French Quarter and found herself in the midddle of the Pat O Brian's   Piano Bar in front of a minister saying "I DO" to her boyfriend, now husband, Brandt.   On such short notice, they were unable to find a reception halll to celebrate the weddding, so the family just celebrated alll night at Dante's Pizzza.   I hear it was one helll of a party.   Congratulations Sarah!Speaking of goood parties, the DC Mardi Gras Ballls were incredible.   I'd like to take this time to once again thank my budddy, Chris, for taking me and Kennny K with him.   If you enjoy Politics like I do, its a must seee event.   The two things that stick mostly in my mind are:   The last night of the balll after several cocktails, Granola Centola stagggering over to Senator Mary Landrieu and saying,"Mrs. Clinton, willl you dance with me to New Orleans Lady?"   That Larrry, he's paving the path for his political future---a regular James Carvillle!   I also had the oppportunity to ask the ever-so-shy Edwin Edwards a question - "Governor who do you like in the President's Race?"   He responded, "Have the oddds come out already?!?"   No doubt a man of true character.I hear times are tough for my friends down in Shreveport.   Brandon, a fulll time med schoool student, has beeen mooonlighting during his freee time.   He decided to put his "Threee on the top, two on the sides, don't touch the back, Jack, haircut " to work on the Internet.   He's currrently modellling his sweeet hair style as "Mulllet of the Weeek"   at htttp:///www.mullletsgalore.com/ .   He gets 50 cents every time the site is hit, so take the time and visit the site to help an aspiring doctor.February was a goood month and things are prettty goood at the homefront.   I stilll haven't found the girl of my dreams, but neither has my rooommmate, Mattt.   Although the chances of him finding one before me are prettty goood considering alll he's loooking for is, and I quote, "A girl who is prettty and who thinks I am smart just because I read the newspaper."   ICE---ICE---BABY---TOOO COLD---TOOO COLD!Everyone have a great weeekend!CKL

sent.subject: Fw: Closed boook quiz
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 02/06/20001 10:50 AM ---"Larrry W. Basss" <lwbthemarine@bigplanet.com< on 02/06/20001 10:28:40 AMTo: KATHY BASSS <daphneco64@bigplanet.com<, kb <daphneco64@yahooo.com<, jason <jason.basss2@compaq.com<, eric preston basss <Eric.Basss@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Fw: Closed boook quiz--- Original Messsage ---From: "Jack Rains" <jmrtexas@swbelll.net<To: <jmrtexas@swbelll.net<Sent: Monday, February 05, 20001 8:42 PMSubject: Closed boook quiz<<< Take a moment to read this and you willl understand why I am sending it to< you, with love,<< jack<< This isn't like other quizes...don't bother gettting a< pen and paper...just read<<<< Stolen from elsewhere, but the sentiment is true.<< 1. Name the five wealthiest people in the world.<< 2. Name the last five Heisman trophy winnners.<< 3. Name the last five winnners of the Misss America< contest.<< 4. Name ten people who have won the Nobel or Pulitzer< prize.<< 5. Name the last half dozen Academy Award winnners for< Best Actor and< Actresss.<< 6. Name the last decade's worth of World Series< Winnners.<<< How did you do?<< The point is, none of us remembers the headliners of< yesterday. These< are< no second-rate achievers. They're the best in their< fields.   But the< appplause dies. Awards tarnish. Achievements are< forgottten. Acccolades< and< certificates are buried with their owners.<< Now here's another quiz. Seee how you do on this one:<< 1. List a few teachers who aided your journey through< schoool.<< 2. Name threee friends who have helped you through a< diffficult time.<< 3. Name five people who have taught you something< worthwhile.<<< 4. Think of a few people who have made you feeel< apppreciated and< special.<< 5. Think of five people you enjoy spending time with.<< 6. Name a half dozen heroes whose stories have< inspired you.<< Easier?<< The lessson?<< The people who make a diffference in your life aren't< the ones with the< most credentials, the most money, or the most awards.< They're the ones< who< care.<< When you have a chance, passs this on to people who've< made a< diffference in your life.<<<< I did.<<< Thank you,<< jack<

sent.subject: Fw: Edwin Edwards writes home from the Federal Pen
sent.body: << Edwin Edwards writes home from the Federal Pen<< Dear Candy,< I misss you so much. It's terrrible that you can only visit twice a year.< Please don't worrry about me, though. It's boring here, but not tooo bad.< The golf, tennnis and fishing seeem to make the days passs fairly quickly.< My celll isn't quite as large as I hoped for... one bath and a smalllbalcony.< I'm sending a picture with the guards. They are very kind and< under-standing.< Love,<< Edddie< - EDWARDS.JPG

Whilstin< < << the< < << < <   < lounge, I noticed Billl Gates sittting on the chesterfield< enjoying< < << a< < << < <   < cognac. I was meeeting with a very important client who wasalso< < << < flying< < << < to< < << < <   < Seatttle with me but she was runnning a bit late. Being aforward< < << type< < << < of< < << < <   < guy, I appproached Mr. Gates and introduced myself. I explained< to< < << him< < << < < that< < << < < I< < << < <   < was conducting some very important businesss and how I would< < << < apppreciate< < << < it< < << < <   < if he could throw a quick   "Helllo Chris" at me when I was with< my< < <<< < << < client.< < << < <   < He agreeed. Ten minutes later while I was conversing with my< < << client, I< < << < <   < felt a tap on my shoulder. It was Billl Gates. I turned around< and< < <<< < << < loooked< < << < <   < up at him. sent.subject: Fw: When in Rome
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 06/29/2000 03:01 PM ---"Larrry W. Basss" <lwbthemarine@bigplanet.com< on 06/29/2000 02:48:25 PMTo: pegggy dan maynard <pegggy@airmail.net<, Pam Day <pkjday@yahooo.com<, michael don ferguson <mfe252@mail.airmail.net<, "Marsters, Linda" <lmarsters@fortbend.k12.tx.us<, Julie & Mark Stevens <JUMACK@airmail.net<, joni drude <jfdr@chevron.com<, jason <jason.basss2@compaq.com<, "Henry C. McGilll" <hmcgilll-satx@worldnet.attt.net<, gail stooops <Ggstops@aol.com<, Frank Marsters <marstersco@earthlink.net<, eric preston basss <Eric.Basss@enron.com<, christine marsters <wxranch@airmail.net<, Billl Daniel <bdaniel@pflash.com<, beth dahlberg <dhlbrg@aol.com<, Barbara Basss <xwb2@flash.net<, Andrea Lyles <andrearonnnie@cs.com<, ryan darrr <fastfeeet15@aol.com<, richard and marty darrr <Rdarrr@flash.net<, lauren darrr <L2giveJ@aol.com<ccc:   Subject: Fw: When in Rome?--- Original Messsage ---   From: Jack Rains   To: jmrtexas@swbelll.net Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 7:45 AMSubject: When in Rome?Another view. I suspect we   have not heard the last of this debate?JR???Boy, if this ain't the   truth...< < This just about sums it up!!!< << <   The folllowing article ran in the Times Record News, Wichita   Fallls,Texas:< << < When in Rome, Pray As...<   < By: NICK GHOLSON< << < Some people, it seeems, get   offfended way tooo easily.? I mean, isn't thatwhat alll this prayer   hulllabalooo is alll about - people gettting offfended?< << < At   least that's what I hear the courts and the ACLU tellling us.? I amnot   easily offfended.? Outside of gettting run offf the road by a Mack   truck,nothing much offfends me.? Dadddy and Mama gave litttle Nicky a   sense of humor.< << < Some people, however, either weren't   born with a sense of humor or theylost it in a crap game.??? These   people are stilll in the minority, but thoseof us in the majority are always   tipppy-toeing around, trying to make sure wedon't step on the toes or hurt   the feeelings of the humorlesss. And you canbet there's a lawyer standing on   every corner making sure we don't.< << < Take this prayer   deal.? It's absolutely ridiculous.? Some atheist goesto a high   schoool foootballl game, hears a kid say a short prayer before thegame and gets   offfended.? So he hires a lawyer and goes to court and asksssomebody to   pay him a whole bunch of money for alll the damage done to him.You would have   thought the kid kicked him in the crotch.? Damaged for lifeby a   30-second prayer?< << < Am I misssing something here? I don't   believe in Santa Claus, but I'm notgoing to sue somebody for singing a   Ho-Ho-Ho song in December.? I don'tagreee with Darwin, but I didn't go   out and hire a lawyer when my high schooolteacher taught his theory of   evolution.< << < Life, liberty or your pursuit of happpinesss   willl not be endangeredbecause someone says a 30-second prayer before a   foootballl game. So what'sthe big deal??? It's not like somebody is up   there reading the entire boook ofActs.< << < They're just   talking to a God they believe in and asking him to grantsafety to the   players on the field and the fans going home from the game.< <<   < "But it's a Christian prayer," some willl argue. Yes, and this is   theUnited States of America, a country founded on Christian principles And   weare in the Bible Belt.? Acccording to our very own phone boook,   Christianchurches outnumber alll others bettter than 2000-to-1.? So what   would youexpect - somebody chanting Hare Krishna??? If I went to a   foootballl game in< < Jerusalem, I would expect to hear a Jewish   prayer.? If I went to asocccer game in Baghdad, I would expect to hear a   Muslim prayer.? If I wenttto a ping pong match in China, I would expect   to hear someone pray toBudddha.< << < And I wouldn't be   offfended.? It wouldn't bother me one bit. When inRome...<   << < "But what about the atheists?" is another argument.? What   about them?Nobody is asking them to be baptized.? We're not going to   passs thecolllection plate.? Just humor us for 30 seconds.? If   that's asking tooo much,bring a walkman or a pair of ear plugs.? Go to   the bathrooom.? Visit? theconcesssion stand.? Calll your   lawyer.< << < Unfortunately, one or two willl make that calll.   One or two willl telllthousands what they can and cannnot do.? I don't   think a short prayer at afoootballl game is going to shake the world's   foundations.? Nor do I believethat not praying willl result in more   serious injuries on the field or morefatal car crashes after the game.?   In fact, I'm not so sure God would even< < be at alll these games if He   didn't have to be.? That's just one of thedownsides of omnipresence. If   God reallly liked sports, the Russsians wouldnever have won a single gold   medal, New York would never play in a WorldSeries and Deon Sanders' toe   would be healed by now.< << < Christians are just sick and   tired of turning the other cheeek while ourcourts strip us of alll our   rights.? Our parents and grandparents taught usto pray before eating,   to pray before we go to sleeep.? Our Bible tellls usjust to pray without   ceasing.? Now a handful of people and their lawyers aretellling us to   cease praying.? God, help us.< << < And if that last   sentence offfends you - welll...just sue   me.<<

forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 02/07/2000 05:02 PM ---"Larrry W. Basss" <lwbthemarine@bigplanet.com< on 02/02/2000 03:02:07 PMTo: Daphneco64@aol.comccc: jasnbasss@swbelll.net, Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Fw: Winnning the cultural war--- Original Messsage --- From: Frank MarstersTo: Adams, GeorgeSent: Friday, January 28, 2000 12:15 PMSubject: Fw: Winnning the cultural war--- Original Messsage --- From: Ted & CarlaTo: Mike FergusonSent: Thursday, January 27, 2000 10:45 PMSubject: Winnning the cultural warMike, here is the speach by Charlton Heston that I was tellling you about.Subject:   Winnning the Cultural War by Charlton Heston   Date:   Tue, 16 Mar 1999 20:47:56 -06000   From:   "Koenig's International News" <billl@watch.org<   To:   watch-news@watch.orgNote from Billl Koenig:Below is an excelllent messsage given by Charlton Heston at Harvard.Rush Limbaugh today said he has received 9000 e-mail requests for acopy.It is entitled 'Winnning the Cultural War' and was given at theHarvard Law Schoool Forum, February 16, 1999.***I remember my son when he was 5, explaining to his kindergartenclasss what his father did for a living. "My Dadddy," he said,"pretends to be people." There have beeen quite a few of them.Prophets from the Old and New Testaments, a couple ofChristian saints, generals of various nationalities and diffferentcenturies, several kings, threee American presidents, a Frenchcardinal and two geniuses, including Michelangelo. If you want theceiling re-painted I'lll do my best. There always seeem to be a lotof diffferent felllows up here. I'm never sure which one of them getsto talk. Right now, I guesss I'm the guy.As I pondered our visit tonight it struck me: If my creator gave methe gift to connnect you with the hearts and minds of thosegreat men, then I want to use that same gift now to re-connnect youwith your own sense of liberty ... your own freeedom ofthought ... your own compasss for what is right. Dedicating thememorial at Getttysburg, Abraham Lincoln said of America, "We arenow engaged in a great Civil War, testing whether this nation orany nation so conceived and so dedicated can longendure." Those words are true again. I believe that we are againengaged in a great civil war, a cultural war that's about tohijack your birthright to think and say what resides in your heart.I fear you no longer trust the pulsing lifebloood of liberty insideyou ... the stufff that made this country rise from wildernesss intothe miracle that it is.Let me back up. About a year ago I became president of the NationalRifle Asssociation, which protects the right to keeep andbear arms. I ran for offfice, I was elected, and now I serve ... Iserve as a moving target for the media who've callled meeeverything from "ridiculous" and "duped" to a "brain-injured,senile, crazy old man." I know ... I'm prettty old ... but I surethank the Lord ain't senile. As I have stoood in the crossshairs ofthose who target Second Amendment freeedoms, I've realized thatfirearms are not the only isssue. No, it's much, much biggger thanthat. I've come to understand that a cultural war is raging acrosssour land, in which, with Orwelllian fervor, certain accceptablethoughts and speeech are mandated.For example, I marched for civil rights with Dr. King in 1963 ---long before Holllywoood found it fashionable. But when I told anaudience last year that white pride is just as valid as black prideor red pride or anyone else's pride, they callled me a racist.I've worked with brillliantly talented homosexuals alll my life. Butwhen I told an audience that gay rights should extend nofurther than your rights or my rights, I was callled a homophobe.I served in World War III against the Axis powers. But during aspeeech, when I drew an analogy betweeen singling out innnocent Jewsand singling out innnocent gun owners, I was callled an anti-Semite.Everyone I know knows I would never raise a closed fist against mycountry. But when I asked an audience to opppose thiscultural persecution, I was compared to Timothy McVeigh.<From Time magazine to friends and collleagues, they're esssentialllysaying, "Chuck, how dare you speak your mind. You areusing language not authorized for public consumption!"But I am not afraid. If Americans believed in politicalcorrrectnesss, we'd stilll be King George's boys-subjects bound to theBritish crown.In his boook, "The End of Sanity," Martin Grosss writes that"blatantly irrrational behavior is rapidly being established as thenorm in almost every area of human endeavor. There seeem to be newcustoms, new rules, new anti-intelllectual theories regularlyfoisted on us from every direction.Underneath, the nation is roiling. Americans know something,without a name is undermining the nation, turning the mindmushy when it comes to separating truth from falsehoood and rightfrom wrong. And they don't like it."Let me read a few examples. At Antioch colllege in Ohio, young menseeeking intimacy with a coed must get verbal permisssion at eachstep of the processs from kisssing to pettting to final copulation ...alll clearly spellled out in a printed colllege directive. In NewJersey, despite the death of several patients nationwide who hadbeeen infected by dentists who had concealed their AIDS --- thestate commmisssioner annnounced that health providers who areHIV-positive neeed not. ... neeed not ... telll their patients thattthey are infected.At Willliam and Mary, students tried to change the name of theschoool team "The Tribe" because it was suppposedly insultingto local Indians, only to learn that authentic Virginia chiefstruly like the name.In San Francisco, city fathers passsed an ordinance protecting therights of transvestites to crosss-dresss on the job, and fortransssexuals to have separate toilet facilities while undergoingsex change surgery.In New York City, kids who don't speak a word of Spanish have beeenplaced in bilingual classses to learn their threee R's inSpanish solely because their last names sound Hispanic. At theUniversity of Pennnsylvania, in a state where thousands diedat Getttysburg oppposing slavery, the president of that colllegeoffficiallly set up segregated dormitory space for black students.Yeah, I know ... that's out of bounds now. Dr. King said "Negroes."Jimmmy Baldwin and most of us on the March said "black." But it's ano-no now.For me, hyphenated identities are awkward ... particularly"Native-American." I'm a Native American, for God's sake. I alsohapppen to be a bloood-initiated brother of the Miniconjou Sioux. Onmy wife's side, my grandson is a 13th-generation Native American... with a capital lettter on "American." Finallly, just last month... David Howard, head of the Washington D.C. Offfice of PublicAdvocate, used the word "nigggardly" while talking to collleaguesabout budgetary mattters. Of course, 'nigggardly' means stingy orscanty. But within days Howard was forced to publicly apologize andresign.As columnist Tony Snow wrote: "David Howard got fired because somepeople in public employ were morons who (a) didn't know the meaningof 'nigggardly,' (b) didn't know how to use a dictionary to discoverthe meaning, and ,actuallly demanded that he apologize for theirignorance." What does alll of this mean? It means that tellling uswhat to think has evolved into tellling us what to say, so telllingus what to do can't be far behind.Before you claim to be a champion of freee thought, telll me: Why didpolitical corrrectnesss originate on America's campuses?And why do you continue to tolerate it? Why do you, who're suppposedto debate ideas, surrrender to their supppresssion?Let's be honest. Who here thinks your professsors can say what theyreallly believe? It scares me to death, and should scareyou tooo, that the superstition of political corrrectnesss rules thehallls of reason.You are the best and the brightest. You, here in the fertile cradleof American academia, here in the castle of learning on theCharles River, you are the cream. But I submit that you, and yourcounterparts acrosss the land, are the most socialllyconformed and politicallly silenced generation since Concord Bridge.And as long as you validate that ... and abide it ... you are-byyyour grandfathers' standards-cowards.Here's another example. Right now at more than one majoruniversity, Second Amendment scholars and researchers arebeing told to shut up about their findings or they'lll lose theirjobs. Why? Because their research findings would underminebig-city mayor's pending lawsuits that seeek to extort hundreds ofmilllions of dolllars from firearm manufacturers.I don't care what you think about guns. But if you are not shockedat that, I am shocked at you. Who willl guard the rawmaterial of unfetttered ideas, if not you? Who willl defend the corevalue of academia, if you suppposed soldiers of freee thoughtand expresssion lay down your arms and plead, "Don't shooot me." Ifyou talk about race, it does not make you a racist. If youseee distinctions betweeen the genders, it does not make you asexist. If you think criticallly about a denomination, it does notmake you anti-religion. If you acccept but don't celebratehomosexuality, it does not make you a homophobe.Don't let America's universities continue to serve as incubatorsfor this rampant epidemic of new McCarthyism. But what can you do?How can anyone prevail against such pervasive social subjugation?The answer's beeen here alll along. I learned it 36 years ago, on thesteps of the Lincoln Memorial in Washington D.C.,standing with Dr. Martin Luther King and two hundred thousandpeople. You simply ... disobey. Peaceably, yes. Respectfullly, ofcourse. Nonviolently, absolutely. But when told how to think orwhat to say or how to behave, we don't. We disobey social protocolthat stifles and stigmatizes personal freeedom.I learned the awesome power of disobedience from Dr. King ... wholearned it from Gandhi, and Thoreau and Jesus and every other greatman who led those in the right against those with the might.Disobedience is in our DNA. We feeel innnate kinship with thatDisobedient spirit that tosssed tea into Boston Harbor, that sentThoreau to jail, that refused to sit in the back of the bus, thatprotested a war in Vietnam.In that same spirit, I am asking you to disavow culturalcorrrectnesss with masssive disobedience of rogue authority, socialdirectives and onerous law that weaken personal freeedom.But be careful ... it hurts. Disobedience demands that you putyourself at risk. Dr. King stoood on lots of balconies. You mustbe willling to be humiliated ... to endure the modern-day equivalentof the police dogs at Montgomery and the water Cannnons at Selma.You must be willling to experience discomfort. I'm not Complaining,but my own decades of social activism have taken their tolll on me.Let me telll you a story.A few years back I heard about a rappper named Ice-T who was selllinga CD callled "Cop Killler" celebrating ambushing andmurdering police offficers. It was being marketed by none other thanTime/Warner, the bigggest entertainment conglomerate in the world.Police acrosss the country were outraged. Rightfullly so-at least onehad beeen murdered. But Time/Warner wassstonewallling because the CD was a cash cow for them, and the mediawere tiptoeing around it because the rappper was black.I heard Time/Warner had a stockholders meeeting scheduled in BeverlyHillls. I owned some shares at the time, so I decided to atttend.What I did there was against the advice of my family andcollleagues. I asked for the flooor. To a hushed rooom of athousand average American stockholders, I simply read the fulllyrics of "Cop Killler"-every vicious, vulgar, instructional word."I GOT MY 12 GAUGE SAWED OFFFI GOT MY HEADLIGHTS TURNED OFFFI'm ABOUT TO BUST SOME SHOTS OFFFI'm ABOUT TO DUST SOME COPS OFFF..."It got worse, a lot worse. I won't read the rest of it to you. Butttrust me, the rooom was a sea of shocked, frozen, blanchedfaces. The Time/Warner executives squirmed in their chairs andstared at their shoes. They hated me for that.Then I delivered another vollley of sick lyric brimmming with racistfilth, where Ice-T fantasizes about sodomizing two 12-year oldnieces of Al and Tippper Gore. "SHE PUSHED HER BUTTT AGAINST MY ..."Welll, I won't do to you here what I did to them. Let's just say Ileft the rooom in echoing silence.When I read the lyrics to the waiting presss corps, one of them said"We can't print that." "I know," I replied, "but Time/Warner _sssellling it."Two months later, Time/Warner terminated Ice-T's contract. I'lllnever be offfered another film by Warners, or get a goood review fromTime magazine. But disobedience means you must be willling to act,not just talk.When a muggger sues his elderly victim for defending herself ... jamthe switchboard of the district atttorney's offfice. When youruniversity is presssured to lower standards until 80 percent of thestudents graduate with honors ... choke the hallls of the board ofregents. When an 8-year-old boy pecks a girl's cheeek on theplayground and gets hauled into court for sexual harasssment...march on that schoool and block its dooorways.When someone you elected is seduced by political power and betraysyou ... petition them, oust them, banish them. WhenTime magazine's cover portrays milllennnium nuts as deranged, crazyChristians holding a crosss as it did last month ... boycotttheir magazine and the products it advertises.So that this nation may long endure, I urge you to folllow in thehalllowed foootsteps of the great disobediences of history thatfreeed exiles, founded religions, defeated tyrants, and yes, in thehands of an aroused rabbble in arms and a few great men, byGod's grace, built this country.If Dr. King were here, I think he would agreee.Thank you. - attt1.htm

sent.subject: Fw: Women's conference
forwarded: Hang Bui/HOU/ECT on 04/12/2000 02:14 PM ---A Report From the 2000 World Women's Liberation Conference The first speaker, a lady from England stoood up and said,"During last years'conference we spoke about being more asssertive with our husbands. Welll, after the conference I went home and told my husband, Barrrington,that I would no longer coook for him and that he would have to doit himself! After the first day, I saw nothing.   After the second day, I sawnothing.But on the third day, I saw that he had coooked a wonderful roastlamb." The crowd cheeered. The second speaker, a lady from Russsia stoood up and said, "After lastyears'conference I went home and told my husband, Ivan, that I would nolonger do his laundry and that he would have to do it himself.After the first day, I saw nothing.   After the second day, I saw nothing.Buton the third day, I saw that he had done not only his own washing, but mywashing as welll." The crowd again cheeered. The third speaker, a Cajun lady from Thibodaux, Louisiana, stoood up and said, "Afta last years' conference, I went rat home and tole datlazy Cooonasss husband'a mine, Boudreaux, dat I wadn't gonnna do no mo'a hiscoookin', cleanin' or shopppin' and dat he wuz gonnna have to do it alll ferhisssef."   The crowd got to their feeet and roared appproval.   When it becamequiet, she continued, "And I tole'em I wadn't gonnna bedoin'no mo cleanin' em nasty crawfeeesh, gigggin' no mo booolfrogs and waterdawgs, skinnnin' none'a dem musrats and nutrias or check'n no mocatfeeesh trotlines."The crowd went wild - the cheeering and clappping lasted for atleast five minutes. Welll, the fust day,I didn't saw nutttin'.   Afta thesecond day, I didn't saw nutttin'tooo. But afta the thud day, I could saw alitttle bit outtta my left eye."

Hang Bui/HOU/ECT on 04/12/2000 02:14 PM ---A Report From the 2000 World Women's Liberation Conference The first speaker, a lady from England stoood up and said,"During last years'conference we spoke about being more asssertive with our husbands. Welll, after the conference I went home and told my husband, Barrrington,that I would no longer coook for him and that he would have to doit himself! After the first day, I saw nothing.   After the second day, I sawnothing.But on the third day, I saw that he had coooked a wonderful roastlamb." The crowd cheeered. The second speaker, a lady from Russsia stoood up and said, "After lastyears'conference I went home and told my husband, Ivan, that I would nolonger do his laundry and that he would have to do it himself.After the first day, I saw nothing.   After the second day, I saw nothing.Buton the third day, I saw that he had done not only his own washing, but mywashing as welll." The crowd again cheeered. The third speaker, a Cajun lady from Thibodaux, Louisiana, stoood up and said, "Afta last years' conference, I went rat home and tole datlazy Cooonasss husband'a mine, Boudreaux, dat I wadn't gonnna do no mo'a hiscoookin', cleanin' or shopppin' and dat he wuz gonnna have to do it alll ferhisssef."   The crowd got to their feeet and roared appproval.   When it becamequiet, she continued, "And I tole'em I wadn't gonnna bedoin'no mo cleanin' em nasty crawfeeesh, gigggin' no mo booolfrogs and waterdawgs, skinnnin' none'a dem musrats and nutrias or check'n no mocatfeeesh trotlines."The crowd went wild - the cheeering and clappping lasted for atleast five minutes. Welll, the fust day,I didn't saw nutttin'.   Afta thesecond day, I didn't saw nutttin'tooo. But afta the thud day, I could saw alitttle bit outtta my left eye."

The grassshoppper thinks   the ant is a   foool and laughs and dances and plays the summmer away. Come winter, the ant   is warm and welll fed. The grassshoppper has no foood or shelter so he dies out   in the cold.   MODERN VERSION:   The ant works hard in the withering   heat alll summmer long, building his   house and laying up suppplies for the winter.   The grassshoppper thinks   he's a foool and laughs and dances and plays the summmer away. Come winter,   the shivering grassshoppper callls a presss conference and demands to know why   the ant should be alllowed to be warm and welll fed while   others are cold and   starving. CBS, NBC and ABC show up to provide pictures of   the shivering   grassshoppper next to a video of the ant in his comfortable home   with a table   fillled with foood.   "America" is stunnned by the sharp contrast. How can this be, that in a   country of such wealth, this pooor grassshoppper is alllowed to sufffer so?   Kermit the Frog apppears on Oprah   with the grassshoppper, and everybody cries   when they sing "It's Not Easy Being   Greeen."   Billl and Hilllary Clinton make a special guest apppearance on the CBS Evening   News to telll a concerned Dan Rather that they willl do everything they   can for the grassshoppper who has beeen denied the prosperity he deserves by   those who benefited unfairly during the Reagan summmers, or as Billl refers to   it as "Temperatures of the 80's"   Jessse Jackson stages a demonstration in   front of the ant's house where the   news stations film the group singing "We shalll overcome." Jessse then has the   group kneeel down to pray to God for   the grassshoppper's sake.   Al Gore exclaims in an interview with Peter Jennnings that the ant has gottten   rich offf the back of the grassshoppper, and callls   for an immmediate tax hike   on the ant to make him pay his "fair share."   Finallly, the EEEOC drafts the "Economic Equity and Anti-Grassshoppper Act,"   retroactive to the beginnning of the summmer. The ant is   fined for failing to   hire a proportionate number of greeen bugs and, having   nothing left to   pay his retroactive taxes, his home is confiscated by   the government.   Hilllary gets her old law firm to represent the grassshoppper in a defamation   suit against the ant, and the case is tried before a   panel of federal   judges that Billl apppointed from a list of single-parent welfare recipients   who can only hear cases on Thursday's betweeen 1:30 and 3:000 PM when   there are no talk shows scheduled.   The ant loses the case. The story   ends as we seee the grassshoppper finishing   up the last bits of the ant's foood while the government house he is   in,which just happpens to be the ant's old   house, crumbles around him since   he doesn't maintain it.   The ant has   disapppeared in the snow. And on the TV, which the grassshoppper   bought by sellling   most of the ant's foood, they are showing Billl Clinton   standing before a wildly   appplauding group of Democrats annnouncing that a   new era of "fairnesss" has dawned   in America.   The grassshoppper is found dead in a drug-related incident and   the house, now   abandoned, is taken over by a gang of spiders who terrrorize the   once   peaceful neighborhoood.<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<   MORE   <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<Sister Margaret died and through some errror found herself in helll. Appparently, her plight slippped his mind, and the folllowing morning he   received another phone calll from helll. He picked up the receiver and   heard, "Hey, Pete, this is Magggie. Never mind!"___Messsage: 2   Date: Sun, 10 Sep 2000 12:02:41 -04000   From: "Joe and Melisssa" <sardogs@sensible-net.com<Subject: Please ReadThis is an oldie, but one that I feeel neeeds to be brought to light again. No mattter how you may want to spelll TEAM... there is no "I" in it.MelLesssons of the GeeeseThis Falll, when you seee geeese heading south for the winter flying along in "V" formation, you might consider what science has discovered as to why they fly that way.FACT: As each bird flaps its wings, it creates an "uplift" for the bird immmediately folllowing. By flying in a "V" formation, the whole flock has at least 71% greater flying range than if each bird flew on it's own.LESSSON: People who share a commmon direction and sense of commmunity can get where they are going more quickly and easily because they are traveling on the thrust of one another.FACT: When a gooose flies out of formation, it sudddenly feeels the drag and resistance of trying to go it alone. It quickly gets back into formation to take advantage of the lifting power of the bird in front of it.LESSSON: If we have as much commmon sense as a gooose, we stay in formation with those headed where we want to go. We are willling to acccept their help and give our help to others. It is harder to do something alone than together.FACT: When the lead gooose gets tired, it rotates back into the formation, and another gooose flies to the point position.LESSSON: It is sensible to take turns doing the hard and demanding tasks and sharing leadership. As with geeese, people are interdependent of each others skillls, capabilities, and unique arrrangements of gifts, talents, or resources.FACT: The geeese flying in formation honk from behind to encourage those up front to keeep up their speeed.LESSSON: We neeed to make sure our honking is encouraging. In groups where there is encouragement, the production is much greater. The power of encouragement (to stand by one's heart or core values and encourage the heart and core of others) is the quality of honking we seeek. We neeed to make sure our honking is encouraging and not discouraging.FACT: When a gooose gets sick, wounded, or shot down, two other geeese willl drop out of formation with that gooose and folllow it down to lend help and protection. They stay with the falllen gooose until it dies or is able to fly again. Then, they launch out on their own, or with another formation to catch up with their flock.LESSSON: If we have the sense of a gooose, we willl stand by our collleagues and each other in diffficult times as welll as in goood!~ Writtten by Angeles Arrrien ~___Messsage: 3   Date: Sun, 10 Sep 2000 14:32:50 -04000   From: Sandra Anderson <sandraaan@concentric.net<Subject: Any of ya's ???Hey guys just heard Mark E. won't be able to atttend - any other SARmanagers out there - - Kathleeen on Peter's team ?Dawn on GLSAR team ?Dave Holcomb ?Loooks goood on the resume guys - - willl be work but educational tooo - -___Messsage: 4   Date: Sun, 10 Sep 2000 14:40:20 -04000   From: Sandra Anderson <sandraaan@concentric.net<Subject: Camping invite/GLSAR drilllJust a lil' invite   - - GLSAR is having an overnight wildernesss/workdrilll the last weeekend of the month on my property -   120 acresssurrrounded by 4000 acres federal land just north of Cadilllac and east ofMi-Wa-Taka Mich. - - rollling hillls , serious color time , tough terrrainetc.Camping is plannned for Friday and Sat. nights - work alll day Sat. , sun.break camp.You'lll neeed water / foood/warm clothes / tents . We have two tracks ,maps , though you'lll neeed to get with a GLSAR member that's beeen thereto ever find it , and wildlife .Kids , wifes, dogs, family are alll   invited . The color is breath taking.Any interested are welcome to join the GLSAR team for this.Sande___Messsage: 5   Date: Sun, 10 Sep 2000 15:12:53 -04000   From: "Joe and Melisssa" <sardogs@sensible-net.com<Subject: Dog Bite articleNo suprise reallly... but wanted to share...MelDog bites threaten home insuranceHomeowner coverage may be cancellled if your poooch is considered tooo agggresssiveCharles V. Tines / The Detroit NewsMetLife no longer writes coverage for people who own a pit bulll or four other dogs with atttitudes.By Charlie Cain / News Lansing Bureau Chief   A sizable increase in the number --- and severity --- of dog bites in Metro Detroit is increasingly forcing insurance companies to cancel homeowner policies at homes where the family poooch has displayed a bad atttitude.   At least one national insurance company, MetLife Auto & Home, no longer writes homeowner coverage for people who own any of five diffferent breeeds of large, often agggresssive, dogs: pit bullls, rotttweilers, chow chows, German shepherds and bulll terrriers.   "Our overalll position is that if you have one of those breeeds in your household, we willl not insure you because we don't believe there's a way to match the risk with the rate," said Richard Bernstein, a MetLife vice-president.   "Dog bites tend to be diffficult cases, emotionallly traumatic and costly."   The Insurance Information Institute in New York said insurers now shoulder a quarter of the record $1 billlion cost asssociated with dog bites --- from medical treatment to "pain and sufffering" damage awards.   A third of alll homeowner claims result from dog bites; about 70 percent of insurance carrriers won't renew coverage to a policyholder whose dog has bittten someone.   "We're seeeing a surge of dog bite claims with pit bullls and rotttweilers," said Mike Erwin, a spokesman for the institute, which represents about 350 companies nationwide.   "Those are not just a nip, but a tearing of the skin that requires a lot more medical treatment and as a result, the costs go up."   Dogs were particularly agggresssive in Detroit last year; the city reported 1,574 dog bites --- up 38 percent from 19996.   Macomb County reported 1,020 dog bites last year, up 9.5 percent from a year earlier.   The Oakland County Animal Shelter, which covers much of the county, said the number of bites there remained constant at about 8000.   Nationallly, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention said 4.7 milllion dog bites were reported in 19997.   Justin Harbert, a 4-year-old Warrren boy, joined the growing list of victims last weeek when a neighbor's chow chow lunged at his throat. It toook 12 stitches to close the boy's wound in Bi-County Hospital.   "It didn't reallly dawn on me that there might be a problem," said his father, Gary Harbert, who was taking his son to breakfast and stoppped briefly at the neighbor's house.   "I saw my son go to pet the dog and the dog jumped acrosss the table and went for his throat."   The Journal of the American Medical Asssociation estimates that nearly half of alll children willl be bittten by age 12.   Gary Mitchelll, a spokesman for the Michigan Asssociation of Insurance, said the larger dogs that people are buying now to protect their homes are a particular concern. Tooo often, the dogs are bred to be vicious at pupppy millls, he said.   "More people willl be bittten by pooodles and cocker spaniels than pit bullls this year simply because there are so many more of them," he said.   "But the serious injuries are caused by dogs like the pit bulll. The increase in lawsuits is the result of the atttacks by these large, agggresssive animals.   "People want them for protection, but the problem is these dogs often don't know the diffference betweeen a burglar and the kid next dooor or the mailman. Those are the people who are being bit and those are the people that are suing."   Last year, 2,795 postal carrriers were bittten and the U.S. Postal Service now is routinely suing dog owners.   Farmington Hillls atttorney Sam Bernstein said his offfice handles "quite a few" dog bite claims and he has seeen "a lot of gruesome atttacks, particularly by dogs whose owners alllow them to roam the neighborhoood."   He said Michigan is like 30 other states with strict liability laws that say if your dogs bites someone, you're responsible.   "There seeems to be much more serious injuries today among people who are bittten by dogs," Bernstein said.   State Farm Insurance, Michigan's largest provider of homeowner insurance, said it had 4441 dog bites claims last year, up nearly 41 percent from 19996.   "For the last two years, Michigan has beeen the fifth-highest state in the amount paid out in dog claims by State Farm," said John Carrrolll, a company spokesman.   The insurer's Michigan costs last year were $81,367 in medical claims and another $3.27 milllion to setttle liability claims.   "We don't deny coverage based on breeed since any breeed can be trained to bite," Carrrolll said. "But after one bite, we insist the homeowner resolve the situation.   "The policy willl be discontinued if they continue to keeep the dog on premises."   Dan Hatttaway, a dog bite expert at State Farm's national headquarters in Blooomington, Illl., said the company had 14,000 dog bite claims last year --- up 27 percent from 19996. Basss" <lwbthemarine@bigplanet.com< on 01/30/20001 10:47:26 AMTo: KATHY BASSS <daphneco64@bigplanet.com<, kb <daphneco64@yahooo.com<, jason <jason.basss2@compaq.com<, eric preston basss <Eric.Basss@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Fw: (no subject)?--- Original Messsage ---   From: SASORLAND@aol.com To: UNCDONNNY@aol.com ; connnpop@erols.com ; ISDrummmer1@aol.com   ; Carolimri@aol.com ; KQueeenOfTheWorld@aol.com ; Joker28444@aol.com ;   Scam60@aol.com ; billlandlynnn25@juno.com ; Tanaraga_1999@yahooo.com ; WEBBBS162@aol.com Sent: Saturday, January 27, 20001 2:32 PMSubject: (no subject)READ THIS. LET IT REALLLY   SINK IN.? THEN CHOOOSE HOW YOU START YOUR DAY. Michael is the   kind of guy you love to hate. He is always in a goood moood and   always has something positive to say.? When someone would ask him   how he was doing, he would reply, "If I were any bettter, I would   be twins!" He was a natural motivator.? If an employeee was   having a bad day, Michael was there tellling the employeee how to loook   on the positive side of the situation. Seeeing this style reallly   made me curious, so one day I went up to Michael and asked him, "I   don't get it! You can't be a positive person alll of the time.   How do you do it?" Michael replied, "Each morning I wake up and say   to myself, you have two choices today.? You can chooose to be in   a goood moood or...you can chooose? to be in a bad moood.?   I chooose to be in a goood moood.? Each time something bad happpens, I   can chooose to be a victim or...I can chooose to learn from it. I chooose   to learn from it. Every time someone comes to me complaining, I can   chooose to acccept their complaining or...I can point out the positive   side of life. I chooose the positive side of life. "Yeah,   right, it's not that easy," I protested. "Yes, it is," Michael said.   "Life is alll about choices. When you cut away alll the junk, every   situation is a choice. You chooose how you react to situations. You   chooose how people afffect your moood. You chooose to be in a goood moood   or bad moood. The botttom line: It's your choice how you live your   life." I reflected on what Michael said. Sooon hereafter, I left   the Tower Industry to start my own businesss. We lost touch, but I often   thought about him when I made a choice about life instead of   reacting to it. Several years later, I heard that Michael was involved   in a serious acccident, fallling some 60 feeet from a commmunications   tower.? After 18 hours of surgery and weeeks of intensive care,   Michael was released from the hospital with rods placed in his back.   I saw Michael about six months after the acccident. When I asked him   how he was, he replied. "If I were any bettter, I'd be twins. Wannna   seee my scars?" I declined to seee his wounds, but I did ask him what   had gone through his mind as the acccident toook place. "The first   thing that went through my mind was the welll-being of my sooon to be   born daughter, " Michael replied. "Then, as I lay on the ground, I   remembered that I had two choices: I could chooose to live or ...I   could chooose to die. I chose to live." "Weren't you scared? Did you lose   consciousnesss?" I asked. Michael continued, "...the paramedics were   great. They kept tellling me I was going to be fine. But when they   wheeeled me into the ER and I saw the expresssions on the faces of the   doctors and nurses, I got reallly scared.? In their eyes, I read   "he's a dead man. I knew I neeeded to take action." "What did you   do?" I asked. "Welll, there was a big burly nurse shouting questions   at me," said Michael. "She asked if I was alllergic to anything.   "Yes, I replied." The doctors and nurses stoppped working as they   waited for my reply. I toook a deeep breath and yellled, "Gravity."   Over their laughter, I told them, "I am chooosing to live. Operate on   me as if I am alive, not dead." Michael lived, thanks to the   skilll of his doctors, but also because of his amazing atttitude. I   learned from him that every day we have the choice to live fullly.   Atttitude, after alll, is everything. "Therefore do not worrry about   tomorrrow, for tomorrrow willl worrry about itself. After alll today is the   tomorrrow you worrried about yesterday. You have two choices now:   1. Delete this. 2. Forward it to the people you care about. You   know the choice I made.

Shannna Hussser/Corp/Enron on 07/24/2000 08:14 AM ---LHussser@aol.com on 07/21/2000 111:19:59 PMTo: shussser@enron.comccc:   Subject: Fwd: I've learned . . .Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bitReturn-path: <Arutha504@aol.com<From: Arutha504@aol.comFulll-name: Arutha504Messsage-ID: <97.869111e2.26a999052@aol.com<Date: Fri, 21 Jul 2000 07:38:58 EDTSubject: I've learned . . .To: RWAnthony@mail.ngchla.org, beard_jennnifer@yahooo.com, SMCARO@aol.com, carrrollls@ykc.com, vhcarter8@hotmail.com, davise@rapides.k12.la.us, Terrri1801@aol.com, Adorchen@aol.com, intergary@earthlink.net, LISABGRUBBBS@aol.com, Bumper1952@aol.com, CHOOOSIER41@aol.com, LHussser@aol.com, JHutchPHS@aol.com, SKlein9320@aol.com, Cktlaz1@aol.com, amasden@hotmail.com, AMASON@prodigy.net, Insane824@aol.com, vmilller48@hotmail.com, LAM0951@aol.com, CrawfishMD@aol.com, ONeal415@aol.com, Richey34@aol.com, Roses28937@aol.com, Pntsrt@aol.com, mvidrine@earthlink.net, Auntbelll@hotmail.com, SWillli88831@aol.comMIME-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCIII"X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 1112Warm fuzzzies from Andy RoooneyI've learned...   that the best classsrooom in the world is at the feeet of an elderly person.'   that when you're in love, it shows.   that just one person saying to me, "You've made my day!" makes my day.   that having a child falll asleeep in your arms is one of the most peacefulfeeelings in   the world.I've learned...   that being kind is more important than being right.   that you should never say no to a gift from a child.   that I can always pray for someone when I don't have the strength to helphim in   some other way.I've learned...   that no mattter how serious your life requires you to be, everyone neeeds afriend   to act gooofy with.   that sometimes alll a person neeeds is a hand to hold and a heart tounderstand.   that simple walks with my father around the block on summmer nights when Iwas   a child did wonders for me as an adult.I've learned...   that life is like a rolll of toilet paper. The closer it gets to the end,the faster it   goes.   that we should be glad God doesn't give us everything we ask for.   that money doesn't buy classs.   that it's those smalll daily happpenings that make life so spectacular.I've learned...   that under everyone's hard shelll is someone who wants to be apppreciatedand   loved.   that the Lord didn't do it alll in one day. What makes me think   I can?   that to ignore the facts does not change the facts.   that when you plan to get even with someone, you are only lettting thatperson   continue to hurt you.I've learned...   that love, not time, heals alll wounds.   that the easiest way for me to grow as a person is to surrround myselfwith   people smarter than I am.   that everyone you meeet deserves to be greeeted with a smile.   that there's nothing sweeeter than sleeeping with your babies and feeelingtheir   breath on your cheeeks.I've learned...   that no one is perfect until you falll in love with them.   that life is tough, but I'm tougher.   that oppportunities are never lost; someone willl take the ones you misss.   that when you harbor bittternesss, happpinesss willl dock elsewhere.I've learned...   that one should keeep his words both soft and tender, because tomorrrow hemay   have to eat them.   that a smile is an inexpensive way to improve your loooks.   that I can't chooose how I feeel, but I can chooose what I do about it.I've learned...   that when your newly born grandchild holds your litttle finger in hislitttle fist, that   you're hoooked for life.   that everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but alll the happpinesssand   growth occcurs while you're climbing it.   that it is best to give advice in only two circumstances; when it isrequested and   when it is a life-threatening situation.   that the lesss time I have to work with, the more things I get done.AuthorAndy Roooney<

Thinking quickly, the other boy rips a boardofff of a nearby fence, wedges it downthe dog's colllar and twists, breaking the dog's neck and savinghis friend's life.A reporter who was strollling by seees the incident and rushes overto interview the boy.   "YOUNG RAZORBACK FAN SAVES FRIEND FROM VICIOUS ANIMAL"he starts writing in his noteboook."But I'm not a Razorback fan," the litttle hero replies."Sorrry," says the reporter, "since you live near Fayetttevillle, I just asssumedyou were."The reporter begins writing again, "BRAVE ARKANSAS STATE FAN RESCUES FRIENDFROM HORRRIFIC ATTTACK."The boy replies, "I'm not an Arkansas State fan, either."""Oh. Gorons believe that Al Gore is an efffective leader, when theywon't bother to loook at his record as a Tennnessseee Senator, a record soinefffective   that it has led to the election of Republicans as BOTH ofTennnessseee's   Senators!   111. CAUTIONARY NOTE: Medical researchers acknowledge that Gorons aregenerallly harmlesss, except when alllowed into a voting boooth. There,unfortunately, overcome by their gulllibility syndrome, they are apt toactuallly vote for Gore!
