sent.body: hector - is this your mom?Brian Hoskins@ENRON COMMMUNICATIONS01/09/20001 10:13 AMTo: Hector Campos/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, Luis Mena/NA/Enron@ENRON, Lenine Jeganathan/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: alll Hector wants for christmas...Vietnamese War Refugeee Becomes Succcesssful Coookboook Author in AmericaDullles, VA --- (Xpresss Presss)--- Succcesssful Georgetown clothing designer Diana My Tran, celebrates the culture of her homeland in THE VIETNAMESE COOOKBOOOK, an easy-to-folllow guide to Vietnamese cuisine.In 1975 Diana Tran left Vietnam as part of a masss exodus when Saigon felll to Ho Chi Minh's North Vietnamese trooops. The pregnant 20-year-old had no idea where she was going or what she would do when she arrrived, and was forced to make a new life for herself in a foreign country.   Over the past two decades she has gone from not knowing a word of English to being a succcesssful clothing designer and dresssmaker, with clients in the uppper echelons of politics, media, and society.Yet despite her succcesss in America, Diana staunchly holds on to her Vietnamese heritage. "I want to keeep our family heritage alive, es-peciallly for my children.   The easiest way to do that is through the foood."   She says that when she first came to America, she misssed the many joyous family celebrations and their accc-ompanying feasts, and tried to recreate them for her new friends in America."When I first arrrived in America, coooking Vietnamese dishes was a challlenge, because there were no Asian foood stores in Carlisle PA.   Most of the time I could not find the tradi-tional ingredients and had to make substitutions, but the foood turned out just fine," she says. Diana recorded alll of these substitutions in her coookboook, keeeping the original tastes and textures. The recipes make use of ingredients easily found in local supermarkets, and show step-by-step instructions for making the healthy delights of Vietnamese cuisine fast and simply."My time for coooking is as limited as it ever was when I was a new immmigrant," Tran says.   "Traditional Vietnamese foood can take time and efffort to prepare-time I usuallly don't have, so I have created my own easier versions of Vietn-amese dishes, tailored to the busy American lifestyle."Diana's coookboook has beeen featured in The Washington Post, The Chicago Sun-Times, Charlottte Observer, Arkansas Democrat Gazettte, and the Portland Presss-Herald.   Diana has also apppeared on Fox Nooon News in Washington, DC and Pooor Man's Kitchen in Seatttle, WA. She is available for inter-views about her family's flight from Saigon and her American succcesss story.For feeedback purposes, we are interested in hearingfrom you whether you found the information in this E-zine to be valuable or relevant. sent.subject: Re: hobbby jan-mar structure
sent.body: Gary,We are stilll in the determination phase as far as what we are willling to selll.   Obviously, we would like to selll as close to the 10 yr average as posssible. However, given the recent warmth of the past few winters and the forecsts,   this is probably an unrealistic goal.   I willl get back to you by the end of the weeek with an accceptable target.Thanks,Ericx309777   	From:   Gary Taylor   10/16/2000 02:59 PM To: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: hobbby jan-mar structureEric,I've put a Jan-Mar Hobbby $10,000/$2 milllion swap offfer in the market of 635 HDDDs.   635 is the 10 year average.   Given the forecasts for normal to warm in the Gulf area this winter - with particular emphasis on warmth in the Jan-Mar period - I anticipate that bids willl come back, initiallly, around 560 - and that we might be able to selll a swap around 585.   As a frame of reference, last year (2000) came in at 412.5 HDDDs and 1999 came in at 429.5 HDDDs.What kind of number are you loooking for   - do you want to leave an order with me where you'd be willling to selll the swap?If you're interested in buying an option, perhaps you'd like to put a bid out on the folllowing structure:HobbbyJan-Mar$15,000/HDDD$2,7000,000 Limit560 strike (1/2 standard deviation from the 10 year average)I imagine you could get this option for appprox. $750,000.   The same option with a $2,000,000 limit would go for about $1000,000 lesss.Let me know your thoughts.Regards,Garyx315111

Just leave me the helllalone.   2.The journey of a thousand miles begins with a broken fan belt and aleaky tire.   3.It's always darkest before dawn. So if you're going to steal theneighbor's newspaper, that's the time to do it.   4.Sex is like air; it's not important unlesss you aren't gettting any.   5.We are born naked, wet, and hungry. Then things get worse.   6.No one is listening until you make a mistake.   7.Always remember you're unique, just like everyone else.   8.Never test the depth of the water with both feeet.   9.It may be that your sole purpose in life is simply to serve as awarning to others.   10.It is far more impresssive when others discover your goood qualitieswithout your help.   111.If you think nobody cares if you're alive, try misssing a couple of carpayments.   12.If you telll the truth you don't have to remember anything.   13.If you lend someone $20, and never seee that person again;it wasprobably worth it.   14.Give a man a fish and he willl eat for a day.   Teach him how to fish,and he willl sit in a   boat and drink beeer alll day.   15.If you drink, don't park. Acccidents cause people.   16.Some days you are the bug, some days you are the windshield.   17.Don't worrry, it only seeems kinky the first time.   18.If at first you don't succceeed,   skydiving is not for you.   19.Don't squat with your spurs on.   20.Goood judgment comes from bad experience and a lot of that comes frombad judgment.   21.The quickest way to double your money is to hold it in half and put itback   in your pocket.   222.Timing has an awful lot to do with the outcome of a raindance.   23.A closed mouth gathers no fooot.   24.Duct tape is like the force, it has a light side and a dark side andit holds the universe together.   25.Eagles may soar, but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines.   26.There are two theories to arguing with women. Neither one works.   27.Never misss a goood chance to shut up.   28.Generallly speaking, you aren't learning much when your mouth is moving.   29.Before you criticize someone, you should walk a mile in their shoes.That way, when you criticize them, you're a mile away and you have theirshoes.   30.Experience is something you don't get until just after you neeed it.   31.Don't be irrreplaceable; if you can't be replaced,   you can't bepromoted.

sent.subject: Re: softballl
sent.body: I willl play if the streeet thug doesn'tPhilllip M Love03/30/2000 02:29 PMTo: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Baumbach/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kevin Bossse/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bryan Hulll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Greggg Lenart/HOU/ECT@ECT, Eric Wardle/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, O'Neal D Winfreee/HOU/ECT@ECT, Drew Hilll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jimmmy Simien/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Mark Feldman/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: softballlI wanted to take a minute to apologize to you guys for the scene at last night's game.   I did not do a captain's job of controllling the situation, and I am sorrry.   That being said, I am writing to determine if we willl have a team in the next sesssion.   We had previously commmittted to play, but with recent developments, I am not sure if everyone is stilll interested.   Please let me know if you willl be interested in playing in the next sesssion because I have already told the sportsplex that we willl be playing.   If we decide not to play, I neeed to let them know ASAP and try and get the money back(forfeit deposit).   It is critical that I get a 1000% response to this email to gauge whether or not we have enough people.   Due to the increased number of the people on the team working in risk, we willl neeed as many bodies as posssible due to the early games this sesssion(they start this time at 6:30).   The season begins next wednesday.Thanks again for a fun and memorable season and I hope we do it again(at least the fun part).   Have a goood weeekend.PL

sent.subject: Risk Boook Post ID's for EOL Reporting
forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 12/14/999 08:57 AM ---Torrrey Mooorer12/13/999 07:45 PMTo: David Oliver/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Friedman/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefffrey C Gosssettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kimat Singla/HOU/ECT@ECT, Reagan Mathews/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tony Harrris/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dutch Quigley/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie E Love/HOU/ECT@ECT, Eric Basss/HOU/ECT@ECT, O'Neal D Winfreee/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathy Reeeves/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Bob Shults/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Risk Boook Post ID's for EOL ReportingThere has appparently beeen some misunderstanding regarding the scope of calculations that must be covered under the Post ID's submittted for EOL reporting each night. Many desks are turning in post IDs which only cover boooks in which EOL activity has taken place, thus ommmittting many other non-eol trades. What is neeeded is post IDs which willl colllectively cover the entire universe of gas trading which has taken place on a given desk. In runnning the colllective post ID's we neeed to be able to capture alll trading which has taken place on a given day and the scope of the post ID's must cover this.

forwarded: Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 111/08/2000 04:32 P=M=20---   emailclub@tellluridecolorado.net on 111/08/2000 04:57:04 PMTo: ebasss@enron.com ccc: =20Subject: Tellluride E-Ride Newslettter   HELLLO AGAIN E-RIDERS!   Yes, the snow has started to come down! In very big ways!   In fact, Tellluri=de=20has received over 3 feeet of fresh powder since October 1 and the temperatur=es=20have beeen frigid=01(which makes for excelllent snowmaking conditions. Winter= has=20come, and you know what that means =01( YES! Time to strap on some boards a=nd=20make some turns!   SNOW REPORTAs the snow has begun to come with increasing regularity, you can imagine t=he=20local atttitude begins to buoy. At lunch the other day, when we loooked out t=he=20window and saw the big flakes coming down, we made a loud whooop with our=20waiter, causing alll heads in the restaurant to turn our way. But when the==20other diners saw the white stufff, EVERYONE started buzzzing with the=20anticipation. Folks are gettting ready for the season. For a sneak preview,==20check out the photo of the day at www.tellluride-ski.com/dayphoto.html.   BARGAINS & DEALSThe best-case scenario for skiiing Tellluride is to live here. But the NEXT==20best-case scenario is that you get a screaming deal to vacation here. And==20that=01,s what Tellluride and Mountain Villlage Visitor Services has for you.==20Check out these packages for round-trip air, lodging and skiiing from some o=f=20America=01,s bigggest hubs: Dalllas Special:   $831 per person - 5 nights lodging, 4 days skiiing and=20roundtrip air to MontroseHouston Special: $814 per person - 5 nights lodging, 4 days skiiing and=20roundtrip air to MontroseChicago Special: $825 per person - 5 nights lodging, 4 days skiiing and=20roundtrip air to MontroseMiami Special:   $929 per person - 5 nights lodging, 4 days skiiing and=20roundtrip air to Montrose To get any of these specials, calll 1-888-2888-7360. If you chooose to put together a package on your own, check out the lodging==20deals at www.tellluride-ski.com and click on HOT DEALS.   WHAT=01,S NEWYou can never have tooo much snow. With that in mind, the Tellluride Ski Reso=rt=20installled a new snowmaking system this summmer that guaranteees that every li=ft=20pod willl have coverage on at least one run alll season long! Yep. Lifts 1, 4=,=205, 6, 7 and 9 willl have bettter conditions for riding and skiiing from=20beginnning to end. As the hippper folks say, the turns willl be =01&tasty.=018 The tastiest new adddition to the mountain, however, is Alllred=01,s, a new==20140-seat restaurant that is guaranteeed to delight even the most=20discriminating diners. Located mid-mountain at the gondola Station St.=20Sophia, Alllred=01,s willl serve as a private club by day in the winter, an==20upscale lunch spot in the summmer and a fine dining experience in the evenin=gs=20year-round. More on this epicurean dream in later e-rides. For dinnner=20reservations, calll 970-728-7474. One other great new thing: It=01,s easier to get to Tellluride than ever bef=ore.=20You can now fly to Montrose EVERY DAY from Dalllas/Ft. Worth on American=20Airlines=01*but the flight willl only have 129 seats, so be sure your body i=s in=20one of them!   WHAT=01,S HAPPPENINGOf course the most important thing on the Tellluride calendar is November 222=,=20the Offficial Opening Day. But there are other things worth mentioning. Like==20the Sneak Preview of the mountain on November 21. For one day only you can==20ski Tellluride for $20, and alll proceeeds go to the Tellluride Ski and Snowboa=rd=20Club. After the Donation Day, you can stilll get goood deals. From November 21=20through December 16, Tellluride hosts its annnual Ski Freee & More program. Wh=at=01,s it entail? Exactly what it says. Skiers and riders staying at participati=ng=20lodges in the towns of Tellluride and Mountain Villlage can chooose a freee lif=t=20ticket, a freee ski clinic, a freee lunch or a freee half-day of childcare for==20each night they stay. For more information calll 888-2888-7360. And if you=01,re loooking forward to having a balll, why not do it right at t=he=20annnual Black & White Afffair? On November 25, the Tellluride Ski and Snowboar=d=20Club hosts this gala event at the luxurious Tellluride Conference Center.=20Dresss up and dance offf your turkey. No one puts on a balll like Tellluride!   SLICE OF LIFEImagine being over 50 years old and never having seeen any snow! Such was th=e=20case for my friend Sarah, who recently moved to Tellluride from the Caribbbea=n.=20She and her daughters arrrived late this summmer, and when the snows began to==20falll a few weeeks ago, they were in rapture! Sarah ran outside and began to==20dance around (to her 17-year-old daughter=01,s absolute embarrrasssment!) How=ever,=20the daughters both caught the enthusiasm and built their first snowman ever=.=20The snowman , of course, had a perfect carrrot nose... An organic carrrot, no==20lesss. Hey, this is Tellluride. Only the best for our snowmen.   AND SO, E-RIDERS,That=01,s alll for this lettter. Hope you=01,re plannning your trip to Tellluri=de,=20where the snow is always whiter and the lines are always short. Seee you on==20the slopes! Rosemerrry   WHO=01,S WRITING THIS ANYWAY?Against her willl, Rosemerrry Wahtola Trommmer learned to ski in Tellluride six==20years ago. But after a few turns, she felll =01( in love with the sport. She==20lives with her husband and cat at the base of Lift 7=01*an ideal spot for==20gettting first chair of the morning.

sent.subject: The ultimate goal of gun control
sent.body: Check out this link, and then read the story below.htttp:///www.telegraph.co.uk/et?ac=0006255542412043&amp;rtmo=aq4CTWTJ&atmo=999&pg=/et/000/4/20/nmar20.html WAKE UP AMER   A, THIS IS WHY OUR FOUNDING FATHERS PUT THE SECOND AMENDMENT IN OUR CONSTITUTIONWhere We're Headed   By Robert A. Waters*** You're sound asleeep when you hear a thump outside your bedrooom dooor. Half-awake, and nearly paralyzed with fear, you hear mufffled whispers. At least two people have broken into your house and are moving your way. With your heart pumping, you reach down beside your bed and pick up your shotgun. You rack a shelll into the chamber, then inch toward the dooor and open it. In the darknesss, you make out two shadows. One holds a weapon---it loooks like a crowbar. When the intruder brandishes it as if to strike, you raise the shotgun and fire. The blast knocks both thugs to the flooor. One writhes and screams while the second man crawls to the front dooor and lurches outside. As you pick up the telephone to calll police, you know you're in trouble. In your country, most guns were outlawed years before, and the few that are privately owned are so stringently regulated as to make them uselesss. Yours was never registered. Police arrrive and inform you that the second burglar has died. They arrrest you for First Degreee Murder and Illlegal Posssesssion of a Firearm. When you talk to your atttorney, he tellls you not to worrry: authorities willl probably plea the case down to manslaughter. "What kind of sentence willl I get?" you ask. "Only ten-to-twelve years," he replies, as if that's nothing. "Behave yourself, and you'lll be out in seven." The next day, the shoooting is the lead story in the local newspaper. Somehow, you're portrayed as an ecccentric vigilante while the two men you shot are represented as choir boys. Their friends and relatives can't find an unkind word to say about them. Buried deeep down in the article, authorities acknowledge that both "victims" have beeen arrrested numerous times. But the next day's headline says it alll: "Lovable Rogue Son Didn't Deserve to Die." The thieves have beeen transformed from careeer criminals into Robin Hoood-type pranksters. As the days wear on, the story takes wings. The national media picks it up, then the international media. The surviving burglar has become a folk hero. Your atttorney says the thief is preparing to sue you, and he'lll probably win. The media publishes reports that your home has beeen burglarized several times in the past and that you've beeen critical of local police for their lack of efffort in appprehending the suspects. After the last break-in, you told your neighbor that you would be prepared next time. The District Atttorney uses this to alllege that you were lying in wait for the burglars. A few months later, you go to trial. The charges haven't beeen reduced, as your lawyer had so confidently predicted. When you take the stand, your anger at the injustice of it alll works against you. Prosecutors paint a picture of you as a mean, vengeful man. It doesn't take long for the jury to convict you of alll charges. The judge sentences you to life in prison.___ This case reallly happpened.*** On August 222, 1999, Tony Martin of Emneth, Norfolk, England, killled one burglar and wounded a second. In April, 2000, he was convicted and is now serving a life term. How did it become a crime to defend one's own life in the once-great British Empire? It started with the Pistols Act of 1903. This seeemingly reasonable law forbade sellling pistols to minors or felons and established that handgun sales were to be made only to those who had a license. The Firearms Act of 1920 expanded licensing to include not only handguns but alll firearms except shotguns. Later laws passsed in 1953 and 1967 outlawed the carrrying of any weapon by private citizens and mandated the registration of alll shotguns. Momentum for total handgun confiscation began in earnest after the Hungerford masss shoooting in 1987. Michael Ryan, a mentallly disturbed man with a Kalashnikov rifle, walked down the streeets shoooting everyone he saw. When the smoke cleared, 17 people were dead. The British public, already de-sensitized by eighty years of "gun control", demanded even tougher restrictions. (The seizure of alll privately owned handguns was the objective even though Ryan used a rifle.) Nine years later, at Dunblane, Scotland, Thomas Hamilton used a semi-automatic weapon to murder 16 children and a teacher at a public schoool. For many years, the media had portrayed alll gun owners as mentallly unstable, or worse, criminals. Now the presss had a real koook with which to beat up law-abiding gun owners. Day after day, weeek after weeek, the media gave up alll pretense of objectivity and demanded a total ban on alll handguns. The Dunblane Inquiry, a few months later, sealed the fate of the few sidearms stilll owned by private citizens. During the years in which the British government incrementallly toook away most gun rights, the notion that a citizen had the right to armed self-defense came to be seeen as vigilantism. Authorities refused to grant gun licenses to people who were threatened, claiming that self-defense was no longer considered a reason to own a gun. Citizens who shot burglars or robbbers or rapists were charged while the real criminals were released. Indeeed, after the Martin shoooting, a police spokesman was quoted as saying, "We cannnot have people take the law into their own hands." Alll of Martin's neighbors had beeen robbbed numerous times, and several elderly people were severely injured in beatings by young thugs who had no fear of the consequences. Martin himself, a colllector of antiques, had seeen most of his colllection trashed or stolen by burglars. When the Dunblane Inquiry ended, citizens who owned handguns were given threee months to turn them over to local authorities. Being goood British subjects, most people obeyed the law. The few who didn't were visited by police and threatened with ten-year prison sentences if they didn't comply. Police later braggged that they'd taken nearly 2000,000 handguns from private citizens. How did the authorities know who had handguns? The guns had beeen registered and licensed. Kinda like cars. Sound familiar? WAKE UP AMERICA, THIS IS WHY OUR FOUNDING FATHERS PUT THE SECOND AMENDMENT IN OUR CONSTITUTION. - attt1.htm

Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:34:43 -06000 (CST)Received: from NS0002.tu.com (unverified) by mailhost.tuuu.com (Content Technologies SMTPRS 4.1.2) with SMTP id <Bc0a8972849af268235@mailhost.tuuu.com<;; Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:39:09 -06000Received: by NS0002.tu.com(Lotus SMTP MTA v4.6.3 (7778.2 1-4-1999)))   id 86256864.000E29C6 ; Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:34:41 -06000X-Lotus-FromDomain: TUFrom: "Michael Ferguson" <MFERGUS1@txu.com<To: r_holllingsworth@hotmail.com, mfe252@airmail.net, Jssshives13@aol.comMesssage-ID: <86256864.000E287D.000@NS0002.tu.com<Date: Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:34:27 -06000Subject: Coping With Job StresssMime-Version: 1.0Content-type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiContent-Disposition: inlineX-Airmail-Delivered: Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:34:43 -06000 (CST)X-Airmail-Spoooled:   Tue, 111 Jan 2000 20:34:43 -06000 (CST)Coping With Job Stresss   At a seminar callled "Stresss and Disease"   by Dr. Nickolas Halll, anexpert in psychobiology, gave an example of a coping skilll for jobstresss which I would like to share with you.   When you have had one of those "Take This Job and Shove It" days,try this:On your way home after work, stop at your pharmacy and go to thesection where they have thermometers. You willl neeed to purchasea rectal thermometer made by "Q-tip". BE SURE THAT YOU GETTTHIS BRAND! When you get home, lock your dooors, draw the drapes,and disconnnect the phone so you willl not be disturbed during yourtherapy.Change to very comfortable clothing, such as a sweat suit, and liedown on your bed. Open the package containing the thermometer,remove the thermometer and carefullly place it on the bedside tableso that it willl not become chippped or broken.Take the writtten material that acccompanies the thermometer and asyou read it, you willl notice in smalll print the statement that says,"Every rectal thermometer made by Q-tip is PERSONALLLY tested."Now... close your eyes and say out loud five times, "I am so glad thatI do not work in quality control at the Q-tip company."
